title: For everyone who wants in-game Voice Chat

embed.description: As you've may have noticed, we've recently made some changes to the old parties system. Before, parties had really rudimentary functionality: You could invite friends to join if they were eligible, you could select your positions and... that was pretty much it.

body: Here's your update, just scroll to the bottom.

replies.body:
I just feel this isn't really all that useful, and could cause alot of issues with the client. I already run discord on my phone for the better speaker and less impact on my extremely low end system.

I can't imagine that there is any problem with voice chat being used for abuse that wouldn't already be encountered through regular ingame chat, so I don't understand why overwatch can have voicechat but league can't. 

Also whilst it's harder to automatically ban people for spoken discrimination and negative behaviour, it's alot easier to judge the tone and context of such language and determine if it's banter or serious abuse through a recording of voice (though i guess you would need to update the ToS and stuff for this).

Remember that recording voice chat is a lot more space and resource intensive than recording text chat. I don't know how Overwatch does it, but I doubt they actually record the chat. I imagine they work it based on reports and comments on those reports.

"and until we have better tools to help address abusive scenarios with strangers"

So yeah we have a way to avoid being banned if we are just in a chat with a premade team and abuse them that way.

Good job Riot.
